111111211221112121112.content:
"Um, no, I didn't." I admit to my friend Sara, before adding something I just realized, "But I'm almost willing to bet you knew the truth before Yasmin showed up and make things just a bit more difficult... right?"

Sara giggles lightly before she responds, "Well if we're coming completely clean, then... yes. I didn't realize right away, but you just so happening to be almost right outside the classroom door definitely clued me in that you were up to something."

"Wait, you're... just going to totally let this blow over, Megan? How can we trust Sara?" Davis interrupts, looking up towards our still giant blonde friend.

"Because I want to trust her, Davis." I answer simply, "You trusted me the other day after my... revelation, so I don't see why I shouldn't do the same for my best friend."

Sara nods, before looking back at her home which she had very recently waded through, none too gently I might add. "...Oh right. I uh... I guess I kind of made a bit of a mess that needs cleaning up before my parents come home..." she mutters, chuckling nervously, "Didn't really think that part through all too well..."

I concentrate, and gradually piece the house back together with my powers. Wooden joists and studs reform as though watching a film on their destruction in reverse, returning to their original positions in the walls and ceilings, while drywall follows them and covers them up once more. Materials mend themselves as though a 25'5" girl (closer to 27 feet with her heels) hadn't smashed her way through her own home. A pretty impressive display, if I do say so myself. An obvious priority for me is ensuring the electrical wiring is as it's supposed to be, as a fridge or stove without power are about as helpful as giant paperweights...

By the time I finish, the sun had almost fully set below the horizon, with the moon and first few stars of the night sky being visible now. The blue glow from Sara's eyes act as somewhat faint spotlights, currently going between me and Davis and the driveway. It doesn't take much effort at all to guess my demigoddess best friend expects her parents to come home any minute now.

Man that's going to take some getting used to...

I allow my eyes to glow green before having myself grow. This time, as I feel my mass quickly increase, I will my clothes to change size with me. It feels rather odd to have the fabric of my shirt slide against my expanding skin, yet not getting any tighter. It's also a relief that I can do this, as ripping out of my clothes gets old after awhile and I'd really rather not end up in the nude in the modern times too often. My muscles tense and relax as they expand within my body, yet never altering my already nicely athletically fit physique. (I'm not into the bodybuilder look) The bones in my body provide minor discomfort as they're stretched to ever-increasing lengths, but it helps a little to distract the sensations triggered as my bra and panties slide against... sensitive spots where they cover under my outfit.

Not long after I started growing, Sara quickly snatches Davis from the ground with her hands, spooking my boyfriend. "You might be safer with me, Davis, until Megan's done." she explains, adding, "And don't either of you dare think of me like that. The last thing I want to do is give any form of justification or truth to Yasmin's ridiculous claims about me being some sort of slut!"

"Yes, um, noted..." my boyfriend squeaks in reply.

My growth continues, and I study how my Converse shoes gradually cover more and more ground to keep pace with my feet expanding inside them. I... really don't want to think too hard on where all the extra material for this is coming from, to be honest. My pants continue to stretch the increasing length of my legs perfectly, the waist embracing my widening (yet still proportionately unchanged) hips comfortably even if the material itself rubs against my skin... less comfortably. I'll try to keep that in mind for next time.

I end my growth standing an impressive 25'4", four times my previous size. It's nowhere near as vast as my default size, but I don't really want to be that big right now. "I'm done for now. You can set Davis down now, Sara." I announce, not bothering to muffle the reverberation of power in my voice.

"Just a second, my friend." Sara giggles before lurching higher herself. I can see my boyfriend blush deeply while in our friend's expanding grip, the skin of her fingers sliding against his somewhat skinny, bare arms, just before she stops at what I would guess is 25'8" without her heels on. With them, she's probably 27 feet tall. Instead of setting my boyfriend down on the ground, the blonde giantess closes the distance between us and gently sets him on my shoulder. "You didn't say where to set him down."

"Fair enough, but why the little growth spurt?" I ask curiously, "And why were you blushing, Davis?"

"Just evening us out..." Sara answers, smiling, "It's a little weird to be holding someone while growing, though."

"I... I suppose I'm a bit worried, here. Both of you are extremely powerful, but... am I going to somehow manifest some ancient power and a past life I didn't even know about?" Davis responds.

"Since I'm the only one I know of to have ever gone through the ritual, the odds of you being more than meets the eye are... I want to say three thousand, seven-hundred twenty to one against. Or about as likely as me getting the role of Titania Girl for the movie they're making now without cheating."

"So then that means I'm by far the most worthless one here..."

"No." I state firmly, "A person's worth isn't something that can be measured with anything tangible. You, Sara, and my family are by far my greatest treasures, and have been long before my reawakening. No amount of money or power can replace you guys!"

Davis smiles at this, though I somehow doubt this has entirely eased his concerns, if he's expressed all of them. I could peer into his mind and discover his worries for myself, but that's a boundary I really do not want to cross with anyone, much less my boyfriend. I didn't even do it with the early humans, and I'm not about to start now.

"Right then, how about we head back inside before my parents come home? I don't want to screw with their perception and think their daughter's always been a towering giant, but I also don't want to try and explain all of this tonight..." Sara suggests after a few minutes.

"Er, how about Megan's place instead? That way neither of you have to shrink if you don't want, and there's already plenty of space. Plus her family already knows about her, so..."

"Hey, I've no objections if she doesn't, bud."

Another night of having my friends over at my place? I'd have to be crazy to decline! "Then it's settled. We'll head over to my place, but we'll walk this time. I don't know about either of you, but I'd like to have some semblance of normalcy right about now." I announce. Neither of my friends object to this, so Sara and I begin the journey after I remove Davis from my shoulder to carry him gently in my arms. My blonde friend pauses for a second to turn back to her home, then rejoins me on our walk. I assume that was to make sure everything inside is back to how it should be and the doors locked.

Our tremendously long strides make what would otherwise be an unreasonably long trek on foot into a rather nice little stroll. I occasionally glance down towards my arms to ensure my boyfriend is faring well, as I want Davis to feel safe. A few people notice me and Sara passing by, but don't give us a second thought. Why would they when they believe two young giantesses with glowing eyes in the city are perfectly normal?

We arrive at my place by around 11 o'clock at night, my parents, Beverly, and Alfred coming out just as I set Davis down on the ground. "Megan Allerson, where HAVE you been?!" my mother yells, "Goddess or not, we were all worried sick about you!"

"Well, Davis and I went over to Sara's place to watch some of the Titania Girl cartoon after school once we did our homework. We... kind of lost track of time and I had forgotten to let you know where I was. I'm sorry I made you guys worry." I answer apologetically, hoping they accept my story. I hate having to lie to them, but I didn't want them to worry more than they already are.

"I see... We should discipline you, but instead we'll let it go just this once. Next time, call us to let us know you're safe." my mother says, her face softening.

"Er, Miss Megan? Why is Miss Sara so large?" Alfred inquires, noticing my blonde friend.

Sara and I look to each other and silently nod before I turn back to my family and reply sheepishly, "Because she wants to be right now. Sara's a demigoddess, born from the early humans that I once watched over. It's a long story."

"Care for a demonstration?" Sara offers, letting her voice reverberate with the power at her command, her blue eyes still aglow. Kind of like the typical depiction of energy technology employed by khalai protoss now that I think of it...

"N-no, thank you, I believe we can all take Miss Megan's word for it..." Alfred declines, as politely as he can.

Soon, my family heads back inside, and Davis follows them in after I bid him goodnight. My demigoddess friend and I summon a pair of sleeping bags appropriately sized for us and almost instantly change into our pajamas. "Thanks for covering for what I put you and Davis through. It was fun, and tricky, but..."

"Don't worry about it. What are friends for, right?" I reassure my friend, "Your eye glow being blue... it's a nod to the protoss, isn't it?"

"Mm... Actually I just went with it because my eyes are blue, just as yours are green, but I guess that works too."

We bid each other goodnight and fall asleep.

1111112112211121211121.content:
A few days have passed since the events of Monday, and things have settled into a surprising normalcy. The big thing was that Sara and I agreed to give the world a break from the use of our powers for awhile. It was actually Davis that suggested it. My blonde friend even got herself caught up on the lessons she missed from Monday on Tuesday without using her powers! Boys were all too happy to lend one of the hottest girls in school their notes. She returned them the next day, to the boys' disappointment. Though she gave a slight nod to Austin, whose notes were possibly the most helpful out of all the ones she had received to help her get caught up.

Yasmin, of course, continued to prove herself an annoyance during this time, claiming her usual lies and false rumors. One of these days, I'm going to have to find out what constantly pisses on her Corn Flakes every morning... Where does her nasty attitude even come from? Granted, she does seem to be easing off these a little bit, so maybe she's questioned her own words a tiny bit since Monday?

On Thursday, Sara and I finally broke the news to her parents. Clara mused she always thought her youngest daughter was special, though this wasn't what she meant. Rick... I had never seen the 6'9" bulldozer of a man so utterly shocked in my modern life. Nor had Sara, for that matter. Yet, like my own folks, they too ultimately accepted it, their love for their daughter winning out over any fears they may have. My friend promised her parents to inform her sister Audrey when she saw her next, so we've that to consider for next week or so.

Today is Davis' birthday, and, fortunately, also a Saturday. I say fortunate because if it had fallen on a weekday, I would be sorely tempted to make it like a national holiday, and thus a day off school. Sara and I had barred him from getting anywhere near his home while everyone prepares for the party, though I did let him take a very generous selection of games with him for this time, including that Special Land of the Dragon: Shattering Future game we were playing the other day. Currently, the two of us are setting up the decorations over the sliding door on the back of the house, with Mary Keck guiding us where precisely to put them. She wants things to be perfect for her son's birthday.

While we're at it, I can't help but giggle slightly as Todd Keck passes between Sara's legs, both of them glad she chose to wear her short shorts today instead of a skirt to avoid seeing her panties. Davis' father is not a short man, in fact he's about average height, but as both Sara and I are at least 19 feet tall right now, (she's a few inches taller, plus a foot factoring her heels in) he can pass under her without trouble. "Hey, Megan? Have either you or Sara seen the latest fashion photos featuring Sonia Enders?" he asks, the mouth-watering birthday cake he's making for his son's birthday now in the oven to bake.

"You mean the one she's sitting among those mountains? Or the one where she's looming over a city?" I ask in return.

"Yeah, those." Todd confirms, "I don't know if you girls follow her or not, but she definitely knows how to use Photoshop and extremely realistic lighting to model outfits, don't you think?"

That was definitely a signature of Sonia's, though oddly, supposedly every modeling agency she's ever worked for has sworn to absolute secrecy on how they come up with these pictures. Maybe they have her do a photo shoot in a toy town like they do for those old kaiju movies? Who knows? "Honey..." Mary says, in that exasperated tone that clearly suggests she's not interested in him talking about a younger woman than her. Not that she has to worry, since I'm pretty sure Sonia's got a boyfriend she's smitten with. "Try to stay focused on our son's birthday preparations, and not on your dream girl."

"But it's so hard not to focus on my dream girl! I've been happily married to her for nearly 30 years!" Todd replies sweetly, "Anyway, I need to run to the store and grab a couple things. I'd appreciate it if someone can just make sure the cake doesn't burn while I'm out."

"Don't worry, I'll take care of it, dear." Mary nods, before watching her husband get in his truck and drive off to the store.

Now, the three of us had told Davis' parents that I'm a goddess and Sara's a demigoddess respectfully, not wanting them left out of the loop because we didn't want to have to lie and keep this a secret from them, and they took it... probably the best out of all of our folks. So while we were still hanging decorations, I ask Sara, "Do you remember if any of the people from the tribes I once watched survived? Apart from yourself, of course."

After a few minutes of silence, Sara responds, "There weren't many of us left by the time I was old enough to actually remember anything clearly... but I do remember the head priest saying that they continued to honor your final wishes, honoring the decision of those wishing to leave. I think that in this way, your influence spread across the globe, as many did indeed part ways with the tribe, and perhaps spread your teachings to those they met."

"I don't think humans ever truly needed me. You know that, right?"

"It's not about need. If nothing else, I'm sure they at least spread your tale, and while the world has forgotten since then..." Sara glances at Mary Keck as she slips inside to check on the cake, "Perhaps Davis' folks are distant descendants of those who felt inspired by your tale? Or, I don't know, maybe they're just more willing to accept us because we've been friends with Davis for ages, and know you've been sweet on each other since you literally ran into each other when he was six."

I giggle softly as I reflect back on that memory. The Kecks had just moved in, and my parents had me come along to greet them. Oh, how I resisted, literally kicking and screaming as I was dragged out of the mansion. I wasn't interested in meeting a bunch of boring grown-ups! Not to mention I was forced into an adorable little frilly pink dress for the occasion. I also had to be dragged out of the limo once we arrived, much to my parents' chagrin. First chance I got, I bolted from their side in order to find something of interest...

As it turned out, I literally ran right into that something of interest.

Returning to the present, I find myself no longer at my boyfriend's place, but at Sara's, feeling awfully cramped inside their living room as I'm still 19 feet tall. Something squirms underneath my butt, followed by a muffled, yet unmistakable, voice yelling desperately, "Get your god-ass off of me!"

Immediately, I shrink down to my typical human size of 6'4" and jump to my feet, then check to make sure Davis is unharmed. "Oh my! I'm so sorry!" I apologize, still a bit confused as to why I'm here, at first.

"Don't worry about it, Megan. I saved my game, so no harm done!" Davis jests lightly, "So... what's up? What brings you here?"

"I got to thinking about how we first met, and... well, I suppose my heart wants to hear your side again." I answer.

"Alright," he nods, "It was 12 years ago today, and my family had just finished moving in to the neighborhood, which didn't make for a great birthday. I didn't know anyone here, and... I was kind of scared of meeting others. Eventually, I decided to drag myself out and say hello... only to crash into a pink blur. And what did this girl say?"

"OW! I'm sorry, I... Oh! Uh... h-hi..." I answer, imitating my younger self of this modern life.

"I half-expected you to start crying, but you gave me a huge surprise when I showed you some of my games. To this day I've never had a girl kick my ass so thoroughly in Super Smash Bros! And then you stole one of my shirts!"

"Well, I couldn't take my dress off, so I went with the next best thing. Besides, I returned it the next day. That dress did make a nice addition to that bonfire, though. I've no shame in that."

Davis and I chat for over two hours, in between playing some games, before Sara telepathically contacts us. Hey, are you two lovebirds ready to come back here for the party? she asks.

How did you know I'd be here? Did you send me here? I ask back in my mind.

Sara responds, I remembered that we left him there until we were ready, and just guessed you'd be with him. Please tell me you didn't accidentally sit on our friend...

Er... Okay, I won't. We'll be over in a few minutes. I reply, and then ask Davis, "Well? Are we ready to go?"

"Sure, if I'm no longer barred from my own home." he replies with a smirk.

I laugh, and teleport us both to just outside his home, out of sight of the guests. Upon Davis and I walking into the back yard, everyone happily shouts to him, "HAPPY BIRTHDAY!!!"

It's just a small party, with only about 8 people including Austin, Chad, Cassie, Joshua, Wendy, and me, Sara, and Davis himself, but he likes it like this. Sometimes, it's just the three of us. Anyway, Davis blows out the candles on his cake after a minute, possibly struggling to come up with something to wish for, and then we all have ourselves a slice of delicious cake. Even Sara, who's still triple her normal size, with Cassie, who's always longed to be giant despite being an already impressive 6'4", looking on.

Presents get opened next. He comes to Sara's present eventually, intentionally avoiding mine, and says upon unwrapping it, "Splatoon Amiibos! But I already have these..."

"WHAT?!" Sara roars, "Davis Keck, you are so-"

"I'm kidding! I've been looking for these for awhile now, so thank you!"

I watch with anticipation as my boyfriend at last gets to my present. "Oh wow... the Warlords of Dreanor expansion, and a three month subscription gift card! Thank you, Megan! I love you!" he exclaims, right before we lovingly embrace. I'm positive that this has been the best birthday ever for him.

11111121122111212111212.content:
That night, I explore the weird as hell landscape of my mind, going over my past lives' memories while my body slept, cuddled up with Davis. I would've invited him in, but he seemed exhausted after his birthday, so I let him be. But yeah, apparently, I was closer to the early humans that had worshiped me than anyone realized in my first mortal life. If I had been chosen for the head priest's ritual to bring me back, odds are good they would've succeeded. But no, the girl who'd eventually be known as Sara got picked instead, though she really didn't do a bad job.

I continue to live out this memory when the demigoddess herself turns to look directly at me. "Oh! You were still with us after all, Megan!" she says, in perfect English. I could list the level of wrong this constitutes, but I'll summarize it with the fact that the English language, as we know it in modern times, won't be invented for at least another millennia from this time period.

"Sara, why are you messing around in my memories?" I ask, returning to my mind's landscape, seeing my blonde friend standing near me.

"I just got curious and poked my head in. I didn't know that would happen!" Sara replies. "Anyway, want to come over into my head? It's had some... redecorating since you poked in there over a week ago."

"Okay, sure." I nod, and we soon find ourselves in very different scenery. Stacks of comic books are everywhere, guarded by huge teddy bears. This isn't new. What's new is the addition of pieces from varying time periods, including a few eerily familiar pieces. A locked door is also present. I recognize it as a representation of the doorway to my friend's bodily functions... like her pituitary. Perhaps that's why it looks like a bank vault door...

"Sorry, but you're not getting in there again." Sara explains, apparently still a little bit sore from the time when I messed with her body, and unintentionally paved the way for her own reawakening. Yeah, we've pretty much put that behind us, and I've learned a valuable lesson to be careful when I go using my powers to mess with people, but I can see why my friend would want to keep me out. "My other half was excited about becoming active while you were, Megan, so, uh..." Sara hugs me, and I of course reciprocate. Feeling our boobs squish against one another is... er, something else.

"So, we may have been together a few times in our past lives. Might be fun to check out later." I say as we end the hug. "Anything else?"

"Yeah, actually. It's Yasmin. Why does she hate us? It's been gnawing away at me for a while now..." Sara replies with a nod.

"We're not changing her personality. We've gotta draw the line somewhere." I calmly remind her.

"Yeah, I wasn't thinking of that." Sara nods in acknowledgment. "But surely you've wondered what her deal is at least once. I want to understand her."

I really dislike Yasmin, due in part to her accusations that I've the school wrapped around my little finger with my family's wealth, which is entirely wrong, and I'd use my powers if I must to ensure it. But what really infuriates me, what really tempts me to turn Yasmin into a puddle of goo, is her calling Sara a horny slut who would fuck anything that moves. Yes, my best friend's sexy, and certainly enjoys being at least near the center of attention, (I've seen her put up to three books in her rack before) but she's no slut! However, despite all this, I'm really curious why she feels this way. Maybe my impression of her was wrong? If so, then why does she insist on the same old tropes she should know by now we don't fit in? "Well I was gonna see eventually... We'll discus it with Davis in the morning, first." I reply.

"No, now." Sara insists. "This way, we might find out more about Yasmin than if we wait."

Before I can even begin to raise an argument, Sara makes Davis appear in front of us. His hazel eyes tiredly open as he asks, "Alright, what is it?"

"We want to explore the mystery of why Yasmin Foxworth is so unpleasant." I explain with a sigh of resignation. "I wanted to wait until morning, but Sara..."

"Wants to go over it now. Figures." Davis sighs tiredly, knowing Sara's strong will, and even downright stubbornness, is very hard to deter. Especially now that she can do virtually anything herself. "I guess that makes sense, given that not one of us knows when Yasmin wakes up in the morning, and it would be best to start just before she does wake up, to get every possible bit of information you can..."

"So you agree with me, then?" Sara inquires expectantly.

"In some ways, but..."

"But what?"

"Do you even know where Yasmin lives?"

"Of course I..." Sara starts confidently, only for that confidence to fade. "...haven't the foggiest clue. Crap." she admits, slouching as the proverbial wind is taken from her sails.

"And we wouldn't be getting in without our powers even if we did know where she lived anyway." I add pointedly.

"Exactly. So, since you'd have to be using them anyway, wouldn't it make sense to just tap into her memories with your powers?" Davis suggests. "It would certainly give you the full answer, like looking into a game's code."

My boyfriend has a point, here. We might not find out why Yasmin hates us just by following her around for the day, and reading her memories would be a far more direct approach. Thing is... I'm kind of scared we might awaken something within her. Silly, I know, but considering it's happened once already, with my best friend, I really want to avoid a repeat of that. Just because the tribes I watched over only created Sara doesn't mean that other tribes didn't have their own goddess or demigoddess that's endured to this age.

"Well, yeah, there's that." Sara admits thoughtfully. "Still, we'd need to disguise or hide ourselves while poking around in her head so we're not adding more reasons to hate us."

"You'd have to do that too if you're going to physically follow Yasmin around, you know." Davis points out while Sara seats herself in the lap of one of the huge teddy bears, its arms bending to embrace her.

"I don't know... Who's to say she isn't like me and Sara? And if we end up awakening that part of her, things could get ugly faster than zerglings can swarm." I say, voicing my concern.

"Didn't you say there was like no chance of that happening, Sara?" Davis questions, seating himself on a stack of comic books. At least a few of them are definitely issues of Titania Girl, the "gateway drug" to my best friend's love of comic book superheroes when it first came out.

"Out of the tribes I watched, dude." Sara nods. "Still, if it happens, we may be able to reason with Yasmin on the principle of not wanting to fucking break reality. I'm pretty sure everyone can agree that's important."

"So long as "reasoning" doesn't involve trying to punch her in the face. Then she might risk it."

"Look, if you don't want to figure her out and understand where this attitude is coming from, that's fine by me." Sara calmly states. "I'm going to get my answers, with or without you, because I think it's worth the risk."

I can tell from her expression that her mind is made up on the matter, and she's not about to be deterred from this. She's willing to leave me be, with no hard feelings, if I don't want to risk stirring something within Yasmin. However, I need to actually make my decision. And then what we're going to do to get our answers, if I indeed still want to learn them firsthand.
11111121122111212111212.title: Figuring out Yasmin

choices: We spend some more time getting to know Yasmin.
111111211221112121112122.content:
Standing here in my best friend's mind, I think about whether or not I'd join Sara in her quest to discover why Yasmin hates us so much. I'm definitely worried either of us might awaken something within the redhead, but at the same time, I did say I was going to see what her problem was, and I meant it. Ultimately, I conclude that I agree with Sara's belief that it's worth the risk.

Besides, I'd rather not let her go alone in case something comes up.

"Alright, you and I'll go in the morning. We'll examine her memories to hopefully get a reliable answer." I announce. "Until then, let's get some rest so we don't do something we end up regretting."

"But-"

"I don't care. Two can play the stubborn game, Sara!" I interrupt.

"I was going to say it's kind of already morning. And no, I had nothing to do with it."

"...Fuck." is all I can respond with.

Shortly thereafter, Davis and I are returned to our proper bodies and wake up. I teleport home to shower and prepare, not wanting to compete for the Kecks' bathroom, then dress in a green shirt with Hyrule's emblem on it, and a pair of shorts, before returning to my boyfriend's place when I'm done. In the time it took me to do all of this, it seems Davis has opted to try and get a little more sleep. I smile and tuck him in a little, placing a StarCrafts zealot plushie next to him in the process, and then exit his room.

Sara appears in the living room, wearing a shirt bearing the Blue Lantern Corps' emblem, and we silently nod in agreement. We're ready to proceed with our plan. I concentrate, and we teleport to our quarry's location. I admit, it feels kind of weird to not know where you're going specifically, and I'm hoping we don't accidentally end up inside any walls. That would be embarrassing...

We find ourselves in a surprisingly normal room, in a house seemingly far from my mansion and my friends' homes. Immediately, I see Yasmin typing away at her laptop, her back turned to us, so I assume this is her bedroom. Honestly, I kind of thought she'd have our faces taped to a dart board. With a silent nod to Sara, we approach Yasmin, intending to make her sleep so we can dive into her memories without being noticed...

"If you're trying to sneak up on me, you're doing a horrible job at it." I hear Yasmin remark, still turned away from me and Sara. Had she noticed us, despite having her face practically buried in her laptop? But then again, if she had, wouldn't she freak out from our sudden appearance? Wasting no further time, I personally compel her to fall asleep before we enter her mind, wanting to be done with this quickly.

Inside, we immediately begin to explore Yasmin's memories, her very past, in search of answers as to what Sara and I've done to earn her scorn and hatred. Obviously, we do what we can to mask our presence in her head while we work, not really wanting to give the redhead more reasons to hate our guts with a burning passion, despite this eerie darkness obstructing our vision of her mental landscape. So far, it appears that her belief that I've the school wrapped around my little finger with my family's fortune may stem from our fathers being old high school rivals, and hers poisoning her mind with false ideas out of his bitterness. Meanwhile, my father's pretty much put that behind him.

"Do you feel that, Megan?" Sara asks me after a couple minutes, causing me to pause my examining of Yasmin's memories for the moment.

"Feel... what, exactly?" I reply, genuinely curious.

"Something doesn't feel right..."

"Getting cold feet?" I ask, jokingly.

"That's not it at all! It's like something's looking back through me... something ancient. If I had a spider sense, it'd be tingling off the charts right now..." Sara responds worriedly. She'd probably look worried, too, if I could actually see her face at the moment

"Well now that you mention it... I feel like someone's delving into my head as I'm peering through Yasmin's memories..." I admit, now feeling it too. "But who-" I begin, only to stop as a disturbing idea wells to the forefront. "Oh no... I didn't..."

"Did what?" A voice asks as a pair of glowing red eyes appear from within the darkness, staring right at us. "If it isn't Megan and Sara. I've been waiting for you."

The darkness lifts, and the landscape of Yasmin's mind is revealed, laid out not unlike my own. Yasmin herself faces me and Sara, eyes still glowing red. "O-okay... don't do anything rash here..." I implore nervously, unsure what she's going to do.

"Where's the string of insults? You know, like how I'm apparently a slut who's likely fucking you right now while you slumber, or Megan can do anything she wants and get away with it?" Sara inquires, her voice dripping with sarcasm.

"Well, she can, but the Allerson family fortune has little to do with it." Yasmin counters, surprisingly calm. "And I know now what I saw on Monday, why you were basically nude, even if no one else remembers it. I have to admit, making me believe I heard someone calling me to keep me off your backs was pretty clever."

"Uh, thanks, I guess?" I say, still feeling like I should be on the defensive just in case. "But yeah, where's the burning hate for me and Sara? We are in your head, so why don't you just get it over with and activate your trap card?"

"Huh? Who said anything about a trap? I've been waiting to cover a realization I've had since Monday's... incident." Yasmin explains. "Okay, maybe more than one."

"Go on."

"Well, I've finally recognized that the three of us share some things in common, and that I've been an ass to you both."

Sara's eyes glow blue, while mine shimmer green. "No, really?" she exclaims sarcastically. "You mean this fancy party trick, or the mental landscape that looks like someone threw various time periods into a blender?"

"Alright, that's it, I'm going to do something about this..." I hear Yasmin mutter, right before we're forcibly evicted from her mind.

I expected to be dead, if it's even truly possible for me, but instead I'm back in the real world. Everything seems to be intact, Sara included, which is good. Yasmin, however, is floating a couple inches off the ground, her eyes blazing red almost in contrast with her relatively calm expression. That's weird on levels I can't easily explain, and I'm kind of used to weird.

"So... yeah. It seems my dad has perhaps influenced my judgment of you, to the point I've never bothered getting to know what you're really like. And since the three of us are goddesses, and basically immortal, it seems stupid to me to continue bearing a grudge against you." Yasmin claims.

"And what about me?" Sara asks. "Where the hell did this perception of me being a slut even come from?"

"You mean... you've never done it with anyone? But why all the flirts?"

"No! My older sister and I were raised to have more respect for our bodies than that, Yasmin. Teasing guys is fun, but the ones falling for it aren't worth my time dating. So far, only one guy in school has even made it past my dad, and his interests lie with someone else."

"Davis Keck, right? Even I wasn't blind to his feelings for Megan."

"Anyway," I say, changing the subject, "Where did you originally come from, Yasmin? How do you fit into all of this? Sara was the only one my tribes created in the effort to bring me back."

"The Void, maybe? I don't remember our origins... I do remember having my own tribes to watch over, though. I may have taken some of your followers in as well, but even a week since awakening it's still fuzzy..." she replies.

"A week?!"

"What, you thought you awakened this just now?" I nod in response. "No, I've just been keeping quiet about it! The time of goddesses watching over humanity is long past, and somehow I doubt many would be so understanding. Still, I might resume my true size one of these days. Maybe a giantess party or something."

"So, I guess this makes us... friends, now, Yasmin?" I ask. Never in my modern life did I think I'd ever put Yasmin and friends together in the same sentence.

The redhead considers it for a minute before shaking her head. "I can't accept the hand of friendship, sadly, at least not right now. I don't know about either of you, but I'm uninterested in messing with people's minds for my personal gain." she replies. "Wow. Never thought I'd be upset about having to decline befriending Megan Allerson and Sara Mars of all people... This is going to take some getting used to..."

"That makes two and three of us." Sara remarks. "Still, we can take our time getting to know one another. I mean, Megan's collection of games is extensive... as is my comic collection."

"I still really need to prepare to soft reset Latios in my Alpha Sapphire game... and make progress with Davis, now that he has the Warlords of Draenor expansion... and a bunch of other things." I admit.

"Huh. Well I can definitely appreciate a good game. Right now, I've been trying to smash the void crystals keeping Amon's portal open. Yay for being put on a timer..." Yasmin remarks.

After a little bit, we head outside, where Yasmin materializes a nasty looking hatchet, promptly burying it deep in the ground. Sara and I get a chuckle at its meaning, but still this is a lot to take in. We might want to take some time away from here for a bit, and the visit with my friend's sister Audrey might be just the ticket. If I remember right, she'd mentioned wanting us to meet someone...
111111211221112121112122.title: Yasmin's secret

1111112112211121211121222.content:
A couple of weeks later, Sara and I return from visiting her sister Audrey. And boy do we have a story to tell! We met a gorgeous plant-human hybrid by the name of Flora, and helped her a bit. I think she's well on her way to mastering her abilities! Oh, yeah, and we let her and Audrey in on what we are, as Sara promised her parents she would. The latter took it surprisingly well... after she came to, anyway. They, and everyone else for that matter, are still unaware that Yasmin's like us, thanks to it completely slipping our minds at the time.

I suppose the first thing I should do is to invite Yasmin over. Get to know a bit more about each other and all. Of course, having her phone number would be really helpful to call her... and like an idiot, I never thought to ask for it. Well, I'll just have to work around that, as I'd like her to get to know my family, and I won't be deterred from at least extending the invitation. As for revealing to my family that she's a fellow goddess... I'll leave it up to her.

After making certain I look as proper as I can, I teleport to Yasmin's house, thankful for Google Earth letting me know the exact address. The front of the house is pretty average in appearance, complete with a mailbox featuring Foxworth on the side near the driveway, and the smell of cut grass lingers in the air still. Taking a deep breath to relax my nerves, seeing as I didn't know what kind of response to expect, I approach the front door and ring the door bell.

The door eventually opens, revealing a man of about the same age as my father, who looks sort of like a cross between Ganondorf if he really let himself go and an orc grunt, minus the tusks. Suffice to say, not very pleasant. "Yes? What do you want?" he replies coldly, his grey eyes boring into mine as though I were something unsightly. He should really look in a mirror sometime.

"Hi, I'm Megan Allerson. Is Yasmin around?" I ask, smiling down at him slightly, but only because of the difference in height.

Now, he could have just answered yes or no. He could have even inquired why I wanted to know if Yasmin was there. Instead, he spits in my face, right before slamming the door in it with enough force to rattle the windows. "NO DAUGHTER OF MINE IS GOING TO BE ANYWHERE NEAR A FUCKING ALLERSON!" he roared from behind the door.

Resisting the urge to do something I'd inevitably regret to Yasmin's father, I decide to depart and wait to invite her the next time I see her. I swear, never in my life have I met a person who makes Lord Garithos seem downright pleasant by comparison! I remain undeterred, but I'm not about to waste my time further. Not when I could be doing quests, or working on preparing to catch Latios in Alpha Sapphire.

Taking the scenic route back home, I stop by the road leading to the local harbor. As I note how it's far wider than normal, I feel myself being lifted into the air. To my alarm, I'm faced with an over 336 foot Yasmin! "Well look who I found..." she says, instinctively filling me with dread. Naturally, I squirm about in an effort to break free, but she responds to this by lifting me to her face and saying, "Hey, here's an idea... Stop squirming so I don't accidentally drop you!"

"Yasmin! What are you doing?"

"Hold on, this isn't working..." is her only response before starting to deflate in size, our surroundings adjusting accordingly in the process. I'm deposited into her dwindling right hand, and her left soon joins to keep me from falling. Her red top and black skirt easily keep up with her as far as I can tell, with less and less material needed to comprise what I guess is her favorite outfit. "Alright, this seems better." Yasmin remarks, stopping at 84 feet. "Now, I was enjoying a walk around town when you showed up, so I could ask you the same question, Megan."

It takes a few moments for things to click back into place in my mind, though the slight hint of contempt in Yasmin's voice is beginning to sour my opinion of her again. Still, it's a fair question. "I was just heading home. I had intended to invite you over, but contemptuous attitudes from you and your old man are starting to make me think twice about that." I reply, unintentionally letting my frustration peak through. "Him spitting in my face was not cool, I might add."

Yasmin's expression turns to one of genuine shock. "Wait, my dad did what? That's... terrible!" she thinks for a moment before asking with suspicion, "But wait, how can I be sure that your folks won't do something just as awful?"

"Actually meet them and you'll see." I reply, noting a tone of interest in there as well. "Anyway, I'll see you later!" and with that, I teleport away, leaving my address for Yasmin in case she's interested.

I reappear back home and proceed with a shower, and some League of Legends afterward. While handing some unfortunate fools their asses, I can't help but wonder if Yasmin would confront her father about his actions, or if he'd get her to ignore my invitation and resume her old hatred... or where her mother was for that matter.

I'm so deep in thought that I don't notice how much time's passed, or my door opening, or the shadow looming over me trying to get my attention. It's not until I feel Sara resting her boobs on my head, giggling like a loon, that I snap out of my thoughts. "And how long exactly have you been waiting to do that?" I ask.

"Hey, at least it got your attention." Sara replies, still giggling as she straightens up again, letting me turn around in my chair to face her... or at least her considerable bust, given that I am sitting. "So what's got you so lost in thought? You didn't even come down to greet Davis, and you always do that!" my blonde demigoddess friend inquires.

As if to prove her point, Davis pokes his head in to say, "Yeah, and it kind of worried me."

I turn my gaze to my friends and ask, "Do you really want to know?"

"Well, yeah." Davis replies without hesitation.

"It's me." a disturbingly haunting voice rings out, before... holy shit... Golden Freddy appears on my bed! Just like in Five Nights at Freddy's, it's sitting there in a crumpled, discarded heap, mouth hanging open while its head rests tilted in an uncomfortable angle, its eye sockets empty and black as the void save for tiny pinpricks of light. "It's me." it calls out in that same haunting voice, if it could even be called that.

Davis screams in utter terror, much to Golden Freddy's... delight? The eyes briefly glow red before it stands and pulls off its head, revealing Yasmin inside. The suit's head evaporates as she doubles over in laughter. "W-what the hell?!" Davis exclaims, his terror escalating as he notices her still glowing red eyes.

"Oh my god that was hilarious!" Yasmin laughs before quickly composing herself, the rest of the suit giving way to her earlier outfit, minus her red Converse. I guess she knows well enough to remove them inside. "But yeah, Megan was probably thinking about me. Dad... pretty vocally forbade me from coming here, but obviously, I came anyway." she remarks, then adds with a wink, "Besides, I figured that since she and Sara invaded my room awhile ago, I'd... return the favor."

"So that means..."

"Yeah, like them, I'm a goddess, but they didn't awaken me." Yasmin confirms. "Pretty good reason to try and drop the grudge, really."

I'm honestly pleasantly surprised she actually came. "Well then, welcome to my home! As you can clearly see, my game collection is pretty damn extensive." I greet. "So, are you willing to meet my family?"

Yasmin hesitates for a moment before answering with a nod, "I am."

I grin, and immediately teleport us into the kitchen downstairs.
1111112112211121211121222.title: Tales and truths of family (part 1)

choices: We get into an escalating situation.
Being introduced to a new little sensation.
11111121122111212111212221.content:
Beverly stares at us in shock for a moment before she shakily says, "Miss Megan, can you please use the stairs next time? My heart is not as young as it once was..."

"Sorry. I'll try to remember." I apologize. "Oh yes. Yasmin, this is my family's maid Beverly. She's one of the sweetest people I've ever known. She and her husband Alfred are like family to us, especially to me."

"A pleasure to meet you, Miss Yasmin." Beverly greets. "Er, if I may inquire, are you perhaps... like Miss Megan?"

"Pretty much, yeah." Yasmin replies. "So where is Alfred anyway? I'm interested in meeting him along with the rest of Megan's family."

"Terribly sorry, Miss Yasmin, but Alfred is currently out on an important errand. However, Miss Megan's parents are currently in the living room, if you'd like to meet them." Beverly states. "It's not often that they can arrange for time away from work, so when they can, they enjoy spending it together."

"But aren't they filthy rich - I mean, extremely wealthy, being Allersons and all?" Yasmin asks.

"They operate their own businesses, Yasmin. They can't just take days off whenever." I explain. "Believe me, if they could have done that, they would've been a lot more involved in my life like they wanted to be."

"R-really? But why tell me this?"

"Partly to dispel the notion that I've had an easy, privileged life. Sara and Davis are well aware of this, so I really don't see a reason to not tell you as well." I inform. "Anyway, care for a drink before meeting my parents? We have Coke Zero, cream soda, iced tea..."

"I'll have some cream soda." Yasmin responds quickly. I can respect someone who knows what they want when they hear it. I personally walk over to the fridge and get out a can of cream soda, as well as a can of Coke Zero, handing her the former as per her request. The redhead practically tears it free from my grasp, and gleefully guzzles the can's contents as though she's never seen cream soda before. "So so good..."

"Apparently, she likes cream soda. Good to know." I remark, remembering to close my jaw.

Shortly after, we enter the living room. I notice Yasmin beginning to tense up, as if anticipating something bad to happen to her, as we enter my parents' view. "Ah, Megan dear! You had us concerned when you didn't come down to greet Davis earlier." my father starts before pausing as he sees Yasmin. "Oh! I don't remember seeing you come in, young lady. I am Jake Allerson, and this is my wife Jillian. Care to tell us your name?"

"Yasmin. Yasmin Foxworth." Yasmin replies, seemingly expecting the worst from her father's old rival.

"Foxworth, huh?" my father ponders. "I've not heard that name in years! By any chance, is your father named Garreth Foxworth?"

"That's him, yes." Yasmin nods.

"You look uncomfortable, Yasmin... why don't you have a seat? There's no need to be shy." my mother offers, gesturing towards one of the plush seats Davis and I tend to use when playing a game down here. As Yasmin gratefully takes a seat, with Sara and Davis soon entering to join us, mother asks my father, "Weren't you and Garreth rivals back in school? However did that come about, dear?"

"Ah, yes... that was bound to come up, wasn't it?" he says sheepishly. "We used to be friends when we were kids. We had a bit of a rivalry going on even then, but it was friendly. We'd congratulate one another for our efforts regardless of who won that time. We earned ourselves quite the reputation as troublemakers, though I think the teachers secretly loved us for brightening their day just a little with our antics...

"All that changed when I told on him. I had to! It pained me deeply to destroy his trust, but once I learned how dangerous what I stupidly dared him to do was, it was the only way I could ensure he wouldn't possibly die! Since then, he's hated anything to do with me..."

We listen on in shock. My father, and the guy who spat in my face, were once childhood friends? And the latter hates him for doing something that very likely saved his life? But I get the sense that Garreth hates my family for more than that, as surely he would've at least let his hate go after so long. But what could reignite a smoldering old grudge to the point where he'd impose his beliefs on Yasmin?

"Yasmin, where is your mother? You've mentioned your father a few times now, but nothing about your mother..." I inquire, the question demanding to be let out.

Yasmin remains silent for a minute before she quietly replies, "My mom... my mom died when I was little. It was so sudden, as she went in one day for a seemingly normal check up, only to find out she had cancer, and the doctors were going to start chemotherapy."

"...Good lord..." my father gasps in horror, while my mother's hand covers her mouth in shock. Sara, Davis, and I wear similar looks. Cancer has that kind of effect on anyone with a moral compass.

"The drugs stripped mom of her strength and vitality. I was barely 7 at the time, and I couldn't understand why mom couldn't pick me up for a hug like she used to, nor could I understand why she looked so ill. Dad and I visited her almost daily. One day, a doctor took dad off to the side, and while I didn't hear what they were saying, I knew as soon as they returned, if only subconsciously, that the drugs weren't working." Yasmin continues. "I told her that I'd see her later, but Lorelei Foxworth, passed away that night at the Allerson Hospital after a valiant battle with cancer. Dad believes you paid the doctors to ensure she died, just to spite him."

"I-I'm so sorry, Yasmin... I did generously fund the hospital, thus why it bears my family's name, but only to help it provide the best medical treatment it possibly could to the community... If I had known that your mother was there, I would've done everything I could to increase her chances of survival from the start." my father says sorrowfully. I've never seen him so upset. "I'd never do something like Garreth believes I did, least of all to him. I can't imagine how anyone could even sleep at night, knowing they had done such a thing."

"Yeah, I see that now. Blindly, I've hated you and Megan thanks to my dad's own misplaced grudge, but I've recently had my eyes opened in an... interesting way. I think I'd prefer it if Allerson and Foxworth were on amiable terms once again, though I don't know if my dad will ever want to step out of the past." Yasmin nods in agreement, her eyes full of tears. I've no doubt that the pain of her loss is just as fresh as the day she found out her mother had died. And from hearing her tale, I've come to hate cancer just a little bit more.

"Well, you coming here is certainly a step in the right direction to that end. If your father turns on you for it... well first, shame on him, but you're always welcome to come over." I say.

"Thanks. I'll certainly keep that in mind."

"I'm sorry to ask, Yasmin, but... What did you mean by having your eyes opened in an interesting way?" my mother asks curiously.

With this, Yasmin's eyes glow red, just long enough to be noticed. "Well, I'm a goddess like Megan, something we discovered recently. My dad doesn't know this, and at least until his relationship with Mr. Allerson improves considerably, I'd like to keep it that way." she replies, smiling slightly.

"Your sweet, innocent, smarter than a damn supercomputer and bored out of her mind little Kimi discovered sex and how gratifying it was." Kimi retorted, "And when was I ever little? Hell, 12 years ago I was taller than most 10 year old kids!"

This was another reason she'd been so popular at school. Kimi loved her with all her heart, and was certain she was truly alive. She never told Rimi what she really did with her boyfriends behind closed doors. She may be coming up on 14 years since she was activated, but she still had the mind and body of a child.

Still, Kimi and her mother didn't see eye-to-eye - figuratively or literally. Her mother had difficulty letting go of the past and accepting her daughter was smart enough to build the world's most advanced robot at age 5 while engineers were still celebrating getting humanoid robots to walk without falling over, and especially wasn't pleased with her sexual conquests. She also felt Rimi should attend school, despite Kimi pointing out it was unnecessary.

Sighing, Kimi finished her shower and got dressed in a casual pair of short-shorts that accentuated her long legs and a nice, if a little short, tank top that exposed a generous amount of both her cleavage and midriff. Exiting the bathroom, she looked her mother in the eyes and said, "I know you're still my mother and all, but I'm a grown woman now. Take pride in that, and respect my decisions for how I want to live my life. Rimi will also be coming with me, as I know you'll unwittingly mistreat and neglect her."

"What makes you think that?"

"You see her as just a robot, and a means to relive the past, not as her own living entity. She cannot perform her own maintenance, so in your care, her efficiency will eventually decay. What's worse, even if you could muster up the will to perform Rimi's maintenance, she's unable to age, while you're unable to stop aging. In short, either you'll unintentionally kill her, or yourselves, if she stays here. I cannot and will not let that happen."

"What's going on up here?" a voice called out. Kimi and her mother turned to see Kimi's dad looking up the stairs towards them.

The two women walked down the stairs to join their beloved man in the kitchen, both hoping to have him agree with their side of the debate. Kimi's relationship with her father was more positive than with her mother, so she believed he wouldn't automatically side with his wife.

After hearing them both out, he remarked, "Hm, you both have valid points. But, I'm going to take neither side. You're forgetting whose desire really matters on this." Looking to Kimi, he added, "And I expect you to respect Rimi's decision if she chooses to stay with us. Perhaps leave us with a manual on how to perform her needed maintenance if it comes to that."

Kimi very nearly facepalmed. She'd failed to consider that as her own living entity, Rimi should be free to choose for herself. If it was taken away from her, she could end up resenting both sides, which was the last thing any of them wanted. "Rimi? Could you come to the kitchen please?" she called.

The sound of excited footsteps could be heard racing down the stairs before what seemed to be a roughly 7 year old version of Kimi skidded into the kitchen. The clothes she was wearing hung extremely loosely from her childish frame, though hints of better fitting matching Hello Kitty tee shirt and shorts could be seen here and there. "Yeah, Kimi?" Rimi replied, unconcerned with the fact she looked absolutely ridiculous practically swimming in Kimi's clothes.

"We require you to make a choice. As you know, I am headed for university tomorrow, where I'll be staying on campus. You can either stay with me there, or with mom and dad here. Know that I won't be upset with you should you choose the latter, and I'll still visit when I can find the time to."

Kimi could see the pain in Rimi's eyes. "Can't... Can't I have both?"

"If I could stay here while attending university, I would not be asking you to choose."

With teary eyes, Rimi seemed to mull over her options. Eventually, she embraced Kimi and replied, "Mommy... daddy... I'm sorry, but I want to go with Kimi. I'm happy you've accepted me since you've known about me. I really, really am. But..." she paused, as though about to say something extremely profound, "I don't know what Kimi would do without me! Oh, and she knows best how to do my maintenance. That's kinda important too, I guess."

Kimi stifled a snicker. More like getting to play dress up with my clothes, huh Rimi? Then again, wearing my hand-me-downs is normal for you... she thought to herself, instead saying as she returned the hug, "Don't you worry, Rimi. We'll be sure to visit mom and dad as often as we can. I'll call the university to make special arrangements for us. I'm sure they'll be willing to accommodate."

Much of her confidence on the matter stemmed from having revealed her intellect publicly, which along with her near perfect marks, drew many big name universities in the US to her like moths to a flame. She'd yet to accept or decline any of their offers, fueling a competition for who'd gain the prestige of having arguably the smartest person in the world, if not recorded history, grace their halls. The one she chose would be out of their minds to not bend over backwards to keep her from looking elsewhere.

In a way, it disgusted Kimi, and she almost wished she hadn't disclosed it, but what's done was done, and she could at least make use of it.

An hour later, Kimi had gotten in touch with the likes of Harvard and Oxford, both of whom declined her request. Allerson University, however, got her in touch with Jake Allerson, who was more than happy to arrange accommodations. He seemed especially interested in Rimi, but all she could do was hope the man's interest in her robotic sister wasn't for all the wrong reasons. Still, this was her best option, and the man had offered to waive the tuition if she and Rimi could meet him in person, which was appealing...

A short time later, both girls had gotten dressed, with Kimi opting for the same clothes she wore yesterday. She drove herself and Rimi in her car after some breakfast and a cup of French vanilla coffee to fully wake up, having not slept that well due to her worry. Fortunately, the trip was about an hour before they found themselves pulling up to a modest little mansion. There was little doubt they had the right place.

The two got out of the car and approached the door. "May I help you, Miss?" an elderly gentleman greeted.

"I'm Kimi Thompson, and this is my sister Rimi. We're here to see Mr. Allerson. He should be expecting us."

"Ah! Follow me, please!" The two did as instructed and followed the gentleman indoors to what seemed to be the living room. It featured several plush chairs that practically begged to be sat in. A Wii U was hooked up to the large flat screen TV. "Master Jake, the sisters Kimi and Rimi Thompson are here to see you."

"Ah, thank you, Alfred." Jake replied, smiling pleasantly. "I'm Jake Allerson, and I personally welcome you to my home. Would either of you like anything?"

"I'd like to know why you wanted to see Rimi, for starters." Kimi stated, her cool, calm voice belying her nervousness.

The middle aged man chuckled and replied, "Is it wrong that I simply wish to marvel at her? Although it seems I'm not the only one she's piqued the interest of..."

As if on cue, a young brunette rushed into view. "Hey! I'm Megan." she greeted. "And aren't you an adorable one! What's your name?"

"Thanks! I'm Rimi! My sister Kimi built me years ago!" Rimi replied, grinning.

"Wow! So you're kind of like a Purifier!"

"What's a Purifier?" Rimi asked with confusion.

"Never mind. I just didn't think it possible to actually encode a consciousness within a robot."

"It was necessary for Rimi's original purpose," Kimi admitted, "But I didn't know the full scope of what I'd created. I'm unsure if I could repeat it, or even if I should try, but I will not relinquish the blueprints to construct robots like my sister for any sum of money."

The meeting continued between Kimi and Rimi and the Allersons for some time. Kimi slowly relaxed as she analyzed Jake and Megan, finding her original fears to be unfounded. The latter, who was slightly younger than her, insisted on showing off her vast game collection, and even let them try some. The former seemed to be a very loving father, and kept his eyes locked with those he was speaking with. Curious, and with little else to do today, Kimi decided she and Rimi would stay a bit longer so she could study the family further.

In the afternoon, Jake offered Kimi a chance to see the university a bit early, as well as meet some of the people attending. Intrigued, she graciously accepted the offer, and Megan came along for the ride. Rather than be forced to take her car, she and Rimi were given a ride in the family's limousine, which she appreciated greatly. "Okay, what's with that look you've been giving me and my father for the past few hours, Kimi?" Megan inquired during the ride, "It feels like I'm being put under a microscope or something."

"I like to analyze others when I meet them, such as yourselves." Kimi explained. "I-I'm sorry if I've offended you, I-I was merely curious..." She feared her actions may have driven yet another person away, recalling the numerous times where babysitters refused to come back during her early childhood because of her. Sometimes she envied how easily Rimi got along with others, though it did lead her to worry about her robotic sister and the intentions of those wanting to see her.

Eventually, the limo arrived at the Allerson University campus grounds. As Kimi exited the vehicle, she was almost immediately struck by how large and sprawling the campus grounds were, having never seen a university campus before in person. She and the others were close to the dormitories, separate buildings for men and women as far as she could guess, but the university building itself appeared to be at least a minute's walk further away.

Approaching the dorms, Kimi noted the campus was abuzz with activity, yet what really captured her attention was a young brunette with practically the body of a goddess. As the woman spotted them and closed the distance with surprising speed, Kimi found herself having to look way up to meet her gaze. "Yeah, I've that effect on people the first time..." the woman admitted sheepishly before kneeling down to a less neck-straining height. "Meg Jenkins. Nice to meet you!"

"K-Kimi Thompson. A pleasure to make your acquaintance..." Kimi responded, allowing her hand to be almost completely engulfed by Meg's in a friendly handshake.

"Rimi!" Kimi shouted, blushing with embarrassment, "You shouldn't be saying things like that in public!"

"Yeah, they are pretty big... but so is the rest of me." Meg nodded, then added with a wink, "Drink lots of milk, kiddo, and you might just grow up big and strong like me! It does a growing body good!"

"And I'm not about to do that, Rimi." Kimi informed, "That would be too drastic of an upgrade. Besides, I'd prefer to not have to look up to you."

"Aww..."

"Wait, is she-?" Meg tried to ask.

"The most advanced robot on this planet is none other than my little sister." Kimi confirmed, almost proudly. "Though perhaps that term doesn't fit her, given how Rimi's very much a living entity."

The group resumed the tour of the campus, now joined by Meg. Rimi wasted no time in asking for a ride atop the huge girl's shoulders, her delight clear as day on her face when Meg obliged her request.

Along the tour, a couple places caught Kimi's attention in particular. The first was what seemed to be a shop class. 142211.content:
You have to hand it to this Sean guy, hiding his letter to Sarah in the one place neither of you ever thought to look. Still, you expect to find something else within that shoe box, but then again why would he leave something valuable in case it never got discovered? Of course, you've only just met this girl, so you don't know what would classify as valuable to her...

Though the letter does leave a couple questions in your mind... "Siblings in spirit?" you ask, confused.

"You know... like a sibling, but not related." Sarah replies, "We're like brother and sister to each other, but we have two separate families and aren't related. At least, as far as we know."

"And this 'soon to be not-so-little goddess' part? Where did that come from?"

"Duh. I told Sean about the dreams, doofus. I... guess he wrote it assuming this would be happening when I'd find it. All part of the 'finding it when the time is right' thing." Sarah says, before starting to look noticeably flushed. "Oh... I-I think I should get out of this house before I can't hide my height from your folks any longer..."

"What, y-you mean you're about to grow?" you stammer, not really at all sure what's going on, "But why hide it from them?"

"Potentially naked girl running past them? Doesn't that seem like something you don't want them to see?"

"...good point." you concede.

Sarah opens the door to your room and exits to head outside, with you following. Your parents seem too distracted with their current activities to pay attention to her and you slipping out of the house, despite being kind of noisy in the departure, but you don't try to discover what has their attention so strongly. Why add more answers you have to somehow provide?

Finally, you and Sarah slip out through the patio door into the backyard. The blonde girl looks terribly ill, and you believe you might feel her burning up if you put your hand on her sweat-laden forehead. However, before you can take a step forward to check on her, Sarah seems to relax her entire body. When she does, to your alarm she begins to visibly stretch taller before your very eyes! You guess she was 5'9" a moment ago, but now she's roughly even with your height.

Another surge, and she's now taller than you. Sarah's tank top lifts higher above her midriff, slowly exposing her bellybutton. Her pant legs recede further up her smooth, practically hairless legs even as the button fails, narrowly avoiding hitting you. Her cleavage looks ever more impressive as her breasts grow a bit faster than the rest of her, and it likely wouldn't be long before at least her bra breaks. "Ah! Shoot! Marcus, would you mind helping me get my shoes off? I really don't want to ruin them!" she asks quickly, though her voice almost has a hint of inviting something a little more than just taking her shoes off...

Nevertheless, you rush towards the growing young woman as she plunks her ass on the grass near the in-ground pool. Thankfully she hasn't tied her shoelaces into particularly difficult knots, so you're able to untie them and with great effort, yank them off her socked feet. As a result of the effort on the second shoe in particular, you end up falling onto your butt on the ground, staring at the Converse logo proudly emblazoned near the back. "I'm okay..." you remark weakly.

"That's good... Thanks. I-" Sarah begins, right before a snap is heard from her back. "I just broke my bra." she states as a matter of fact, "Besides that, I really like those shoes. An acquaintance of mine, Minnie, recommended I give them a try, so I did."

You watch as Sarah's growth continues while she casually tugs the useless bra out of her increasingly too small tank top. Her pants start splitting at the seams as her legs become too thick to be restrained. Yet as it seems she would completely grow out of her clothes, her growth stops. You don't know whether to be disappointed or relieved. Sarah smiles as she says almost teasingly, "Sorry man. Guess I'm not going naked just yet. Shame I couldn't have at least torn out of these socks..."

Sarah reaches over and pulls the overworked socks off her feet before planting said feet on the ground in order to stand to her full height. You behold her head rising well above yours, her too tight clothes threatening to snap off at any moment. You trace your eyes down to her abdomen, which is flat as a washboard with the slightest definition of a six-pack developing just beneath the surface. Her arms also have maybe a bit of muscle showing. "Holy crap..." is all you can muster.

"I know, right? I think I'm about the same height as my mother now!" Sarah comments, again in a slightly sultry tone, "I mean, it's a little creepy at first, but this is kind of thrilling." Her moves are surprisingly fluid, seemingly well practiced despite having just grown to what she's guessed to be about 6'4", the same height as her mother Jasmine. It's honestly turning you on, if just a bit.

In fact, nearly everything she does now is starting to arouse you. Is she unconsciously flirting with you? How can anyone do that, though? Regardless, you ask to try and clear your head, "Um, what am I supposed to do with your shoes? And how the hell do we explain this to your parents?"

Sarah walks over to you and bends down to help you up. "I'll take my shoes back, thanks." she answers with a heartwarming smile, "Well, mom kind of already knows. I couldn't really sneak past her, and I also told her about my dream all those years ago. Still, I'll just have to tell them up front. And get in touch with Sean to let him know I've finally found what he left for me. Eventually."

"W-why eventually? Why not get in touch with him now?"

"Because... because he's probably busy right now! If he's working right now, I don't want to do anything that might get him fired from his job." Sarah replies to your question, "God knows it's hard to secure one these days. I've even tried the Baskin-Robbins down the road from the comic store and they wouldn't hire me. I don't even have a criminal record or anything."

You get the sense that Sarah's hesitant to get in touch with Sean for other reasons, but you decide not to push the issue. Regardless if she considers you a friend or not, your gut tells you not to anger the girl who's already taller than you and is likely going to be growing even bigger in the near future. Surely she'll do it when she feels comfortable doing so. Taking another glance at her, you note that Sarah and her mom are indeed quite comparable at the moment. You can scarcely imagine how much bigger she's going to get, even if your thoughts keep coming back to it repeatedly.

1511.content:
Y'La was an interesting creation. By human standards, the way her mind had been especially engineered to carry out a specific task would be considered excessively cruel. Unluckily for her, the species, that bred her did not come with any such moral hubris. Though they possessed a great deal of knowledge, that knowledge was drenched in the blood of centuries of battle; wherein the conditions were a breeding ground for an intense push for the pursuit of knoweldge by all members of their kind! If only it weren't for barbaric purposes.

During one of many great wars, genetic engineering pushed forward to increasingly unethical levels, even to them. It started out with weapons being welded to flesh. a firearm that could be triggered with an arm muscle. A propulsion device that could be controlled with new muscles. And eventually, instead of modifying existing soldiers, they created new ones. Of the two sides, whose causes for battle were lost to the history books, one emerged staggeringly victorious, thanks to its staggering army of specifically created soldiers.

In that way, the purpose for which Y'La was born is seemingly antithetical to the the recurring motif the species represented. She was programmed to be nice, happy, friendly, and all other sorts of human adjectives, in order to gather information about humanity. The aliens hoped that with more knowledge on human culture and life, they would be able to establish contact as quickly as possible in order to trade for resources. So they made her as human as they thought possible, essentially copying guides on the human body from the planet earth, with little regard to specifics.

Unfortunately for them, her human details were far too perfect...so perfect, she was imperfect...and that would be the fatal flaw which could possibly doom the planet they were attempting to make contact with.

---

Y'La had scarcely gained consciousness for the first time when planetfall was engaged, and the pod she was secured in rocketed out of the alien ship. Her mind reeled from many sensations all at once, not used to this sensation...or any sensation! But drilled in instincts took over, and she found herself smiling inside the pod as fire lit up the porthole. Intellectually, she knew some assumed basics about being human. She knew how to walk, how to talk (albeit, exaggeratedly), and how to act on at least most normal human situations, from the perspective of an alien species. Eventually she would then be picked up, though she didn't know that, and the information would be forcefully extracted from her, an operation that almost certainly kills.

But fate had other plans for her.

Thoughts streamed into her head. No, words! And she spoke, despite no-one being able to hear her. Like she had been speaking for decades. "I'm spinning! No, falling! Falling..to earth! To make friends! When am I going to-"

Before her words, and thoughts, were finished, they were deafened by the sound of a rather forceful impact! However, it didn't seriously hurt her in the way she would've thought, and by the appearance of a deep blue all around her, her mind caught up to her. Water! She had landed in water.

Pulling a lever on the pod, a hatch flew off at the top, allowing her to take a step out and breathe her first breath of fresh air. She was going to like this place...it felt like home. Wait...it WAS home, right? Now she was confused. "I...why was in that...pod? To make... friends! But...why would...hm..." she says to herself, finding that she doesn't know the answers to more than a few questions. But her programmed personality causes her to not dwell on those facts, and her face contorts into a smile again, as she decides to survey her surroundings, looking for someone to call a friend. She finds that she is...
1511.title: Y'La; Alien, Ditz, Friend.. Confused? And Growing.

15112.content:
Y'La wrapped her arms around herself and shivered. "Brr! Cold! Gotta find land, get warm!" Looking out to the horizon, she spotted a strip of whitish-yellow. "Sand! Land!" Without another thought, she leapt into the water. Obviously, at least to natives of the planet, if the air was cold then the water would feel even colder. Her shriek echoed over the waves as the alien girl desperately windmilled her arms in a frenzied swim to shore.

Massachusetts wasn't exactly known for its beaches even in the warmest seasons, and especially not during winter. Of course, there was always the odd exception and in this case the odd exception was Bridget, a petite brunette. Ever since she was a child, Bridget had been fascinated with the sea. She'd saved up for her own aquarium tank, but couldn't yet afford fish, so for now she was stocking it with natural shells and near-shore sea creatures like sand dollars and washed-up starfish. With a Tupperware container of salt water in an old Radio Flyer wagon, she wandered the beach in full cold-weather gear to find more knick-knacks for her soon-to-be fish sanctuary.

The shriek of panic caused Bridget to stand bolt-upright, looking out to the sea. The water was frothing from something flailing, and it was coming her way. As it drew closer, she realized it was a girl! In some sort of purple bodysuit, with platinum blonde hair so light it was practically white, the girl appeared to be using her arms like steamboat paddles in a frenzied attempt to swim ashore. Bridget couldn't blame her; even just wading into the shallows to pick up displaced critters, the water was fuck-off cold.

Y'La continued to swim even after she'd reached land, dragging herself along the beach and still babbling a litany of synonyms for "cold" before she bumped into a little dune. She blinked, sat up and crossed her eyes to see the granules on her nose. "Sandy...? Land! I'm on land," she laughed with childlike enthusiasm.

Despite fearing for her sanity should she interact with this girl, Bridget couldn't just leave her to freeze. The poor girl was still shivering fast enough to pass for being battery-powered, her softer parts jiggling all the while. That bodysuit left nothing to the imagination... "Uh, hey, you alright?"

The green-haired girl sprang up from the sand almost faster than Bridget could track, her shivers replaced by quivers of excitement. "A friend! I've found a friend!" She leaped forward and tackled Bridget in a huge bear-hug.

"Wagh! What the hell!?" She tried to pry the strange girl off her, but the cold girl had a surprisingly powerful grip. "Lemme go!"

"A'kay!" And like that, the girl released her and sat happily beside Bridget.

The brunette shook her head. "Okay, listen, who are you...
15112.title: Beach Blanket...Alien?

choices: By morning, Y'La has grown only slightly. (Bridget doesn't notice.)
