151121.content:
"...Where are you from?"

The brown-haired girls words seemed to bounce around in Y'Las mind like a ping-pong ball, before her head cocked to the side slightly as she responded with: "From Earth!"

Bridget didn't know how to respond to that, so she just stared. Was this girl really this stupid? Or was it the hypothermia? Even as the strange blonde girl smiled, her body was shivering up a storm, as much as it seemed like she was fighting it. Even her teeth was beginning to chatter as she gave a toothy grin. Unfortunately for Bridget, she couldn't help but feel sympathy for her fellow human being.

"You still haven't told me your name, you know." Bridget asked. "My name?" Y'La replied. "Yeah, your name. What's your name?" Y'La thought about this for a few moments. She had never considering her name until now, but found she already knew the answer. "Y'la!" she finally stated proudly. "Yuh-La?" Bridget repeated, eliciting a nod. "Well, Y'La, you don't look like you have anywhere to go, and I can't leave you out in the cold...do y'wanna come home with me to warm up?" Bridget asked, wondering if she would regret this immediately, or much later.

Y'La sprung a smile even larger than her last one, if you could believe it. "Yes! Thank you, thank you, thank you!" she babbled, jumping out of her sitting position and standing proudly on the sand, before wrapping Bridget in another tight hug. She wanted to complain, but instead found herself awestruck at the fact that she was breast level with this girl. She was 5' 11" herself, but this weird lady was huge! And...busty, apparently. She had to be at least 8 feet tall!

Her grip was so tight, though, it felt like she was going to suffocate. Looks like this girl really doesn't know her own strength. "Okay, you can let go now!" Bridget squeaked out, and Y'La complied, dropping her onto the sand. Part of her knew this wouldn't end well. "Can you grab my wagon? I'm gonna go get the heat going in the car." Y'La nodded furiously, and before Bridget took even 2 steps, she heard the sound of the entire contents of the wagon falling into the sand, as apparently the giant woman was lifting the wagon right over her head. "Good...you got it." Bridget deadpanned, before sighing. "Let's just go."

"And by the way, the name's Bridget."

---

Bridget was again shocked by the strange girl she picked up at the beach. Not because of her staggering height, or any hidden features, but because of how...confused she seemed to be. The girl was poking the heater in the car like it was an alien object, before staring through the car windows with eyes full of wonder. Just where did this girl come from?

The cryptic answer from earlier didn't help much, either. Earth. Duh, earth! She meant more specifically! But is that was this girl thought was the right thing to say? Was she stupid? Mentally damaged? Or did she just not know any better? Why was she in freezing cold water at this time of day? And her 'suit'...Bridget shuddered. The girl takes up a lot of space, and on her way into the car, Bridget touched the suit. It felt like...a completely new texture. Like if Metal and Leather had a baby. And the designs on it looked, well, tacky, but also pretty alien. Infact, it didn't look like much of a wet suit at all...she had no idea what it was.

Whatever the case, they had arrived at Bridget's place. "We're here!" she announced, and Y'La just stared at the sight before her. "Wow..." she muttered, apparently pleased with what she was seeing. "So many doors!" Bridget rolled her eyes. "Let's go. My apartment is upstairs."

---

Bridget didn't have it in her to be surprised by the girl at this point, and it didn't seem like she would be anyway. Once again, Y'La didn't say a word as she took in the sights and sounds of the apartment she found herself in, though the only thing to hear was the fireplace she was in front of. Bridget was no expert on dealing with hypothermia, but getting the person warm seemed like the right course of action. So a blanket and fireplace later, Y'La was still shivering, but she might not die. That's a step up, in her book.

As soon as Bridget flipped on her (rather small) TV, Y'Las eyes were on it like a hawk. "What's that?" she asked. "A TV. It's kinda hard to explain, so just watch something with me."

And they watched TV for hours. Bridget, because there wasn't much else to do while you hang out with someone you don't know, and Y'La, because she was so enamored with what she was watching. It was so intriguing, so...educational. Luckily for her Bridget pointed out when something was fictional after noticing her taking in everything like fact. So now she understood fiction much better. Y'La was becoming cultured, and bonding (at least to some degree) with Bridget.

More time passed. The sky was already darkened by clouds, but now it seemed like the whole sky had vanished, leaving cold emptiness outside. Bridget began to yawn from the comfort of her couch, and Y'La from the warmth of the fire. And eventually, they both nodded off after a day full of...well, not excitement. But discovery. And for the first time ever, Y'La would dream. She'd dream of discovery, of exploration, and of growing... friendship.

And that friendship will grow, alright, but it'll be a little... one-sided.
151121.title: Y'La and Bridget. Best friends? Maybe? Why not.

1511212.content:
Bridget rolled out of bed, the glare of the sun cutting into her eyes. She looked over at her clock; it was nearly 10:30. It was unlike her to oversleep, but her thoughts were quickly interrupted by a thud in her living room. "What the hell?" thought Bridget, but soon she remembered the guest she took in yesterday. 'Yuh-Lah' seemed friendly enough, but her skin was so pale, and her hair was green. And she was so... Bridget entered the living room to find that Y'La's head was bumping the ceiling. "Holy fuck what the hell happened to you?" exclaimed Bridget. Y'La was confused by this remark, as she saw nothing wrong. Sure, her new friend seemed smaller today, but that was normal, right? Months ago, a couple of scientists decided to try and tackle the issue of world hunger. Everyone knows humans need food to live. Everyone also knows that most plants use photosynthesis to create their own food using sunlight. And everyone is well aware of genetically modified plants, even introducing the DNA of certain animals into plants to give them greater resistance to given situations. They can't just uproot and relocate themselves, obviously, that's just silly. But it did get the scientists to thinking if they could do it the other way around - introduce plant characteristics into animals, and eventually humans.

The idea was to allow human cells to house a bit of chlorophyll that would subtly feed the person while in the sunlight, but hopefully not so much the person's skin turns a leafy green. On paper, it sounded brilliant, but tests would be needed to see if it's possible. In practice though, something somehow went awry, creating what seemed to be a successful cell carrying the properties of both a human and plant, but the cell began dividing like crazy before any further tests could be done on it. By the time the scientists began to realize something was wrong, the cells had already begun to specialize into familiar structures of a brain, heart, and numerous others. "Well shit. We've accidentally created life!" one of the scientists said in frustration.

Rather than sterilize the experiment, as was proper procedure, the scientists allowed this rapidly growing... thing to continue to develop, keeping it well watered and nourished, though the latter proved to be about as hard as keeping a normal plant in the light. Within days, their creation had taken on the recognizable form of a fetus... albeit green, and could watch it develop right before their eyes. One of the scientists approached her in an attempt to cut her open and learn about her anatomy... but the positively frightened look in her eyes broke his will to carry out the act. Shockingly, Flora demonstrated a learning pace that was as fast as her development, learning words and how to communicate almost as quickly as the new information could be presented to her.

During all this time, the scientists were trying to replicate the previous result, but without any success. Could one or more of the materials used in Flora's creation have been contaminated with an unknown substance? Or perhaps a freak genetic quirk that allowed this to happen? Either way, it seems to this day that the answers may have been lost when Flora first started developing.

Some time later, the people providing the funding for the project came by to see if it was going anywhere. They were... less than enthused to find out progress had stalled. Something strange is going on around here, and the blonde wants to find out what.

People look on in awe and fright as the 50 foot Flora begins to break out into a run. Even if they know that the plant woman would never intentionally harm any of them, which not all of them do, it's hard to ignore the imagination going over the various ways in which she could end their lives in grisly, gruesome detail. And yet, the light of the sunset playing off her huge, bountifully curvy frame is still a sight to behold for those believing themselves a safe distance from her.

For Flora's part, she's just trying to avoid stepping on anyone while also ensuring Audrey doesn't fall off her shoulder.

Thanks to her tremendous strides, Flora quickly arrives at Audrey's home with her passenger safe and sound. Carefully, she reaches up to her shoulder and lowers her friend to the ground. "It's about damn time you got here, Audrey! I was getting worried sick about you!" a girl standing just beside the open door says, "I mean, how would I break the news to mom and dad that you've gone missing?"

Flora bends down a bit lower, almost on her hands and knees, to get a better look at the girl. She has similar golden blonde hair and blue eyes as Audrey, among a few other things that show they're closely related. However, she's clearly taller even without the heels, likely 6'5", and her clothing style leaves little of her body's hourglass shape to the imagination. "Sorry, Sara, I thought you were coming tomorrow..." Audrey apologizes, "I wouldn't have kept you waiting otherwise, sis."

Sara's expression softens and replies before they embrace, "Fine, I forgive you, Audrey. What are sisters for?" Shortly after they part from each others' arms, Sara looks towards the giant plant woman studying her and asks very calmly, "Friend of yours, I take it?"

"Yes, actually. This is Flora. She's a plant/human hybrid, and is easily as intelligent as she is beautiful. She's uh... not usually this big, but she'll return to her normal size in a couple hours." Audrey says.

"Nice to meet you, Sara!" Flora greets warmly, waving a large hand in the process before she asks, "But... where is your friend? Did they decide not to come after all?"

Just then, Flora feels the sense from earlier return, stronger than ever. "Ah, but she did decide to come! And would appreciate you not accidentally falling backwards, Flora..." a voice remarks.

The plant woman stiffens with worry, forgetting for a moment that her current posture would more likely have her fall on her prodigious chest than backward, before a small hand pats her calf. At last, the owner of the voice appears before Flora's gaze. This girl is barely shorter than Sara, yet a little bustier. The green eyed brunette is clad in a dark green dress and green sneakers, and much to Flora's relief didn't seem frightened of her at all. She could almost swear she sees glimmers of blue dangling from the girl's ears. She seems pretty normal... yet Flora can't shake the feeling this girl is more than she appears.

"Well, I guess I should introduce myself here. My name is Megan Allerson. Just Megan is fine." Megan introduces herself, smiling. She then approaches Audrey and offers her hand. "And you must be Audrey Mars, Sara's older sister! I've got to say, it's nice to meet you in person after seeing you in some of the family photos my friend has shared."

Audrey accepts the handshake, replying, "Megan Allerson, huh? I think I've heard of your family before. They own that mansion the next town over, right?"

"That's the one. I was born with a silver spoon in my mouth, which was sure helpful when it was time for baby food." Megan acknowledges jokingly.

Sara excuses herself and pulls her friend aside, unknowingly still just within earshot of Flora. "Please don't... change my sister in any way, Megan..." she whispers.

"Honestly, you think I'd do such a thing?" Megan replies, almost flippantly. A few moments under her friend's withering glare, she relents, "All right, so I've done it once... or twice... Fine, I won't mess with her..." a moment later, she adds, "At least, not without her permission."

Flora doesn't understand what the two are getting at, but it's making her tremendously curious. Naturally, given that she wasn't supposed to hear their conversation, the plant woman does her best to feign ignorance when they turn back to her and Audrey, who genuinely is oblivious to the discussion.
1531112.title: A curious trip home

choices: Flora wakes up in the morning, still remembering last night.
Flora thinks it was all a freaky dream...
15311121.content:
Gradually, as the hour passes, Flora's tremendous size diminishes. The plant woman is in some ways... a little saddened to be returning to her normal size, which felt strange considering the previous times she's grown and has been relieved to be returning to her normal size. Then again this has been the only time where she's grown and not put anyone in potential danger, so it is possible that may be a contributing factor, and she is still looking forward to being able to fit inside Audrey's house once again. Flora does note that she's shrinking more slowly than normal, which causes her mind to ponder what mechanisms are at play with her ability and its ties to direct sunlight. Now that she's no longer afraid of it, there's much she wishes to learn about it...

While she sits outside, Flora can hear some of the things going on inside her friend's house. She turns her head and lilac gaze towards the building, her curiosity making her lean a little closer towards an open window to see what's going on. "How's a girl supposed to get in on tonight's Splatfest without TV? I brought my Wii U and everything!" Megan bemoans, leaving Flora to wonder what a "we you" is and what it has to do with a "splat fest".

"I've never really found myself having time for TV. Sorry." Audrey apologizes, "Maybe I'll look into getting one later if I can afford it and a DVD player. As is, I'm lucky to not have to use the local cafe's WiFi for everything."

"Uh, continue the tour without me, sis." Sara says as she heads out of view, alerting Flora to the fact her watching with curiosity hasn't gone unnoticed. "Hey, um, Flora? How long does it normally take for you to be back to normal height?" she hears her friend's sister's voice question.

Flora turns her head towards the blonde and adjusts her slowly diminishing position to give her her full attention. She's already caught on to the fact Sara is trying to mine some information out of her, but really doesn't seem the harm in answering. "Another hour before I'd be back to that point, though it doesn't seem like I'll be that small by then tonight. Usually, it is a lot more visibly noticeable than this."

"I see... Well I guess there's nothing for it but to give it time, then." Sara remarks.

Flora can see the young woman's face showing the slightest sign of resisting some internal desire, yet she can only guess what that desire is. "Indeed. This is the first time I've tried to control this, as previously I just grow out of control until I can find shade." she explains.

"Huh. Well if you can keep yourself from growing and grow to a target size... maybe you can shrink down to normal, too?" Sara suggests after a few moments of thinking.

"I've tried before, and it does not seem to work like that..."

"Try harder." Sara implores, her eyes glowing blue for a few seconds, just long enough for Flora to catch a glimpse before it's gone. With that, the blonde gently pats the plant woman's back before heading back indoors to rejoin Megan and Audrey. Just before the door closes completely, the plant girl spies the young woman make a fist pump, though she has no idea what it is for...

Setting that mystery aside, Flora's incredible mind recalls the glow in Sara's eyes with clarity. The plant girl swears that glow wasn't from any external force, having studied enough of human anatomy to know human eyes lack a reflective layer in the back of the retina like certain animals do to bounce any light back out, and it was only for a moment. Yet she did not know how the girl's eyes glowed, much less why they did. Needless to say, her curiosity and interest is peaking, her thirst for knowledge wanting her to learn what she can about this.

After a few moments of dwelling on what she's seen, Flora decides to give another try at forcing herself back down to her normal size. At least here, outside her friend Audrey's home, there's little to distract her mind from focusing on her goal like a laser. In a matter of moments, her green body begins to withdraw into itself at an increased pace, the world seeming to rush up and expand out in all directions to greet her. She rises to her full, dwindling height, feeling her frame lighten by the second. Her leaves become smaller and narrower as well, still keeping the appearance of a bikini even if the temperature currently feels a bit too cool for that.

Eventually, the plant girl feels the compression of her voluptuous body slow to a halt, leaving her at her normal, towering 7'10" height. Out of curiosity, she attempts to focus on becoming even smaller... but to no avail, much to her minor disappointment. Flora's leaves rustle as she crosses her long, slender, supple arms together across her prominent, prodigious chest and shivers lightly. There are admittedly times where she considers wearing human clothing, especially during winter, though this may also hinder photosynthesis... She wastes no further time in entering the familiar walls of Audrey's house, though takes care to ensure her long, flowing cherry blossom pink hair doesn't get caught in the doorway. She had learned a painful yet valuable lesson the last time she let that happen...

Inside, the plant girl enters the kitchen to prepare herself a sandwich to eat, knowing Audrey usually keeps some sliced ham in the refrigerator. She's by no means a vegetarian, she happily consumes meat just like most humans. As she brings out the things she wants to put in her sandwich, Flora gets the sense that she's not alone in the kitchen... yet she sees no one when she looks over her shoulder. "Hmm. I must have imagined it..." she concludes, trying to shake off the feeling as she finishes making her sandwich.

"Imagined what?" a familiar voice asks curiously from directly behind the plant girl, causing Flora to yelp in shock and surprise when she turns around, unintentionally dropping her sandwich in her shock. Faster than she can perceive, the owner of the voice catches her intended meal well before it can hit the ground. "Whoops! Didn't mean to startle you!" Megan apologizes, a slight, friendly giggle escaping her lips.

Taking a few moments to let her heart gradually resume its normal rhythm and stop trying to pound its way out of her chest like a jackhammer, Flora is able to regain her composure (mostly) and inquire, "Megan! W-where did you come from?!"

The brunette, slightly more than an inch shy of reaching the base of Flora's neck, smirks as she answers, "Well, Flora... when a mommy and a daddy love each other very much..."

"That was not what I -" Flora starts as she and Megan walk to the table, only for her to stop as she catches on. "Oh. Ohhh... Sorry, I tend to not immediately catch some of the subtler social cues..."

"You're an outsider to human society. I get it. Kind of like Dr. Temperance Brennan from Bones, if she were part plant." Megan says, smiling, "...you have no idea who I'm referring to at all, do you?"

"None whatsoever, I'm afraid... Er, could I have my sandwich back? I do not know how you managed to catch it so impossibly quick, but..."

Megan's green eyes flickered in response to the plant girl mentioning having seen her catch her sandwich unnaturally fast. She reaches up to her ear, playing with one of her Master Sword earrings while her face appears to hint at some internal debate, and finally sighs. "I was kind of hoping to avoid having to tell you this, but you're alarmingly clever..." she says as she hands the sandwich back, "Well, why don't you have your sandwich first?"

Flora nods, and quickly begins to eat the sandwich she prepared, which also takes an unsurprisingly short amount of time for her to finish even though she by no means rushes to consume it. During this time, Sara enters the kitchen in her pajamas, teddy bear tucked under her right arm while the left pulls open the fridge door for a cold glass of milk. "Oh! I see you took my advice from earlier, huh, Flora?" she remarks sweetly, a smile spreading on her remarkable face. "So, what are you and Megan chatting about?"

"I did, and it seems to have worked." Flora replies with a nod after swallowing the last of her meal. She turns her attention back to Megan, still expecting whatever it was the brunette was supposedly hoping to avoid having to reveal as Sara walked over to the table to join them.

"I guess I still need to confess, then..." Megan admits, "I'm a goddess. I watched you and Audrey return from that old park earlier, but kept myself hidden."

Flora is about to express her lack of belief in Megan's claim when she sees Sara drop her glass in surprise... only for it to stop just millimeters from hitting the floor, floating in the air until the blonde picks it up, leaving her bear hovering until she wraps her arm around it again in the process. "Oh yeah, and Sara here is a demigoddess. It's a long story..." Megan adds calmly.

Presented with seemingly overwhelming evidence that the brunette's claim is true, and the questions in her mind about all of this multiplying faster than she can process them, Flora loses consciousness, flopping heavily onto the table, which groans slightly in protest. Exhaustion likely has also played a part in what has happened. "Well that could have gone better..." Megan remarks quietly.

"Gee, you think?" Sara says, her voice dripping with sarcasm.
15311121.title: Divine revelation

choices: Flora gets some more practice in.
Audrey overheard everything, and is more than a little upset...
153111211.content:
While Flora remains unconscious, Megan uses her power to alleviate the situation, causing the plant girl to snooze peacefully instead. She and Sara decide to take this time to examine their new friend as carefully as they could, pushing her limp body back into her seat first to get her off the table. Before they can begin to sate their curiosity, however, Sara's sister Audrey enters the kitchen. "What was that noise?" she asks, before noticing Flora's body slumped back in her seat, "What the hell did you two do to Flora?"

"We didn't do anything harmful to her, Audrey! Honest!" Sara answers her older sister's demand, "The day's excitement must have caught up with Flora, and so I guess her mind needs time to... I don't know, sift through it all or something."

"Flora flopped on the table, so we pushed her back into her seat." Megan adds, "Though ideally we should probably move her someplace more comfortable... Do you have someplace where she usually stays when she visits?"

"She usually sleeps on the couch in the living room." Audrey answers, "At any rate, you two make sure to turn everything off before going to bed, and make sure my friend is comfortable. Good night." and with that, Audrey turns around and heads back to bed.

With her gone, Megan and Sara resume with the examination. They note how the leaves in Flora's hair are very much attached, and even her leafy anklet around her right leg is subtly attached to her body. What surprises them more is both how pleasant she smells, like a natural perfume, and how utterly soft her skin is, including the soles of her feet. It seems to them that everything about her physically is meant to be as comforting as possible... if not mentally as well. The question is why?

Regardless, the two physically move the plant girl to the couch, noting how heavy she is, nearly 350 lbs. Once done, Megan creates a thin blanket to cover the sleeping green beauty, as well as a pillow to rest her head, and then the girls turn in for the night.

It is only when the first rays of the morning sun come through the window to caress her face does Flora begin to stir from her slumber. She yawns sleepily, her lilac eyes slowly opening... until she recognizes the strange feeling of the blanket on top of her body. It's strange because she didn't usually sleep with one, let alone one plenty large enough to cover her. It was... nice, actually, as was the pillow that she also didn't usually use. "Where did these come from?" she asks herself in confusion.

The plant girl's memories of last night click in her mind. Megan's sudden appearance... Sara dropping her glass and leaving her teddy bear floating in mid air... And the brief glow of the latter girl's eyes. Megan called herself a goddess, and Sara a demigoddess! But... such things don't exist! There's been no scientific evidence that such beings exist! "Am I losing it? Gods do not exist... do they?"

And yet, Sara and I do exist, Flora... Megan's voice answers within the plant girl's mind, Come outside if you want further proof, but please don't faint this time.

Curiosity getting the better of her, Flora gets up, carefully stretching her arms so as to not accidentally hit anything in the process, and walks outside. The morning sun feels amazing on her towering, verdant frame, which she greets with a pleasant smile, but it's not long before the entire house is cast in a strange shadow. Flora stops just before crashing into an equally strange green wall, easily stretching more than twice her height. It seems to taper down at one end, which is capped in white, while the other end has a star emblem encircled by the word Converse...

It dawns on her as she spots the wall's twin a ways off, at an impossible distance for staying on Audrey's property no less, that she's looking at a massive shoe. Stunned, the plant girl backs away a few steps and cranes her neck up. Past the sock-covered shin, beyond a very familiar dark green dress... and up to the massive, smiling face of Megan. "Good morning, Flora! You wanted proof? This should do very nicely!" she greets, bending down to scoop the plant girl up into her hands as gently as possible.

As she's lifted up into the air, well past any height she's personally reached to date, Flora is at a loss for words. There are so many questions she wants to ask, she fears her mind will be overwhelmed once more. Yet, she feels as though much of them are being repressed, allowing her to compose what she really wishes to say and ask the giantess whose hand she's currently sitting in. "What... how..." she starts, right before being interrupted by a loud tune dominated by an electric guitar nearby. "What is that racket?!" she asks, covering her ears.

"Oh, that? That would be the opening theme to X-Men: The Animated Series... and Sara's ringtone. Don't worry, she'll answer it in a moment." Megan answers, still keeping her voice low enough to not be painful, yet still it reverberates with the power at her disposal.

Indeed, the tune stops with a beep, followed by Sara speaking, "Hello? Oh, hey Davis! Megan's a bit busy talking to a friend of my sister at the moment... No, you can leave the message with me and I'll let her know right away. Okay, we'll talk to you later, bud." Flora turns her head as the blonde comes into view, seemingly at the same enormous scale as her friend. "That was Davis. He wanted to let you know he's still doing okay, and hopes we're faring well. He groaned a bit when I mentioned you talking with Flora." Sara then looks down upon the plant girl and waves. "Hi! Don't mind us being so huge, Megan here likes to assume her true size for a bit around this time."

"Hey, I can totally stay 6'4" for as long as I want to. I just like returning to my true size now and then, that's all."

"And I'm more than happy to keep you company at this scale, so it works out."

"Er, excuse me, but... What is this "X-Men" you were referring to?" Flora interrupts, curious, having never heard of this sort of thing before.

"It's a cartoon from the 90's based around the comic book series of the same name. Sara's been into them since Titania Girl hit stores years ago, and still upset she missed the casting call." Megan explains.

"Eh, more bummed than anything now... Though I am curious how well this Valerie Smith girl will do in the role." Sara admits before changing the subject, "But somehow I doubt you want to listen to a demigoddess geek out about comics, right? No, you'd rather have some questions answered, wouldn't you, Flora?"

After a few moments, Flora nods and proceeds with some of her questions. "Y-yes. How is the property being extended without anyone noticing? How are you two able to avoid causing panic?"

"I don't want to accidentally crush anything underfoot, so I will the land to make room for me. And unless we want them to, no one thinks our size is at all strange. A 360 foot giantess and her slightly taller friend are so mundane to them... apparently." Megan answers, then adds sheepishly, "Honestly, even we're at a bit of a loss as to how it all works other than it just does."

"I think I know what you'd like to ask me, and the answer is no. Audrey's not a demigoddess, and she doesn't yet know that I am, but I'll be telling her before we head home. I promised my parents I would, and I'm a girl of my word." Sara informs.

"I see..." Flora responds, feeling her position in Megan's enormous hand to be increasingly uncomfortable. She's used to towering over people with her 7'10" height, not feeling like an insect in someone's hand. However, it'd be a couple hours yet before she would have absorbed enough direct sunlight to be able to grow, and she doubted these two would stay massive for that long, so she decides to keep her discomfort to herself.

Gradually, with the giantesses taking a seat on the ground in the process, the plant girl asks the question that recently has been burning in her mind. "Are either of you responsible for my creation? I believe it was roughly 20 years ago now. Audrey believes I have a deep connection to nature, and it has made me question why I exist..."

"We're not, otherwise I'd have a definite answer for you on the other part of your question." Megan answers, "But, it's obvious that you have a much deeper connection to nature than humans. You are part plant, after all, and most people... don't really pay much attention to nature these days."

"But..."

"We don't think you're an accident, Flora. We may never really know who or what may have had a hand in creating you, or why, but I think my sister's on to something." Sara interrupts, "I, for one, am just glad you do exist!"

Flora is pleased to know that Audrey's sister likes her as well, as well as Megan, who nodded in agreement with the blonde's sentiment. Audrey's really the only friend she's had in her life, so she's grateful to now be making a couple more, even if they're quite... extraordinary. This belief also serves to make resting back in Megan's hand more tolerable, knowing she's not in any danger. The plant girl resolves that she will make every attempt to show she means no harm whenever she's giant, as this experience has given her valuable insight.

She may still be no closer to understanding the reason for her existence, but perhaps that's a mystery she can allow time to reveal the answer to...
153111211.title: Grand awakening

choices: Flora continues practicing growing and holding.
Next step: returning to normal in daylight.
1531112111.content:
A short time later, Flora is back to facing a more normal sized Megan and Sara, which while she had gotten far more comfortable with being giant, was still a relief to her that she was taller than them once more. She could theorize all day about why she feels that way, but recognizes it wouldn't be productive, and since she now knows she can control this growth ability of hers, she wishes to get as much practice in as possible so as to be able to master it. Her mind wanders through some possibilities once she has mastered this ability, like gaining a clue to the reason of her existence, and even the question of if she can shrink back to her normal height while still exposed to sunlight.

In the meantime, Flora and her new friends head inside for breakfast. Megan had bought several breakfast items from McDonald's, and now they were about to enjoy the meals in Audrey's house. "This meal's caloric content is alarmingly high, along with the sodium..." Flora remarks, as though no one else present knew this already or cared. And in all honesty, the scent of eggs, sausage, and hash browns is making her mouth water.

"Yeah, this isn't the healthiest thing to put in one's body in the slightest. But it's not that bad as long as you don't eat the stuff like every day." Sara confirms, even as she wastes little time in devouring a hash brown.

"Sara has a point, you know." Audrey says, having joined the three for breakfast. "Besides, since my sister and her friend went out of their way to get breakfast at McDonald's for everyone here, who are we to look a gift horse in the mouth?"

"That doesn't make sense. There are no horses present for miles, at least as far as I am aware, let alone in front of us! And why would someone wish to look a horse in the mouth, gifted to them or otherwise?" Flora responds, mistakenly believing Audrey is talking about real horses.

"It's a figure of speech, Flora. Just enjoy it as a treat." Audrey sighs, proceeding to start on her meal before it gets cold and motioning Flora to do the same with hers.

The plant girl complies, and takes an exploratory nibble into her food. Deciding that she enjoyed the taste, Flora proceeds to consume the rest of her meal in earnest. She hasn't tried any fast food before, for various reasons, but she can perhaps understand why humans seem to enjoy it so much now. The oil left behind on her fingers from the hash brown is decidedly... less pleasant, and she quickly wipes it off with a napkin. Another is used to clean off her naturally rose petal colored lips, a color she's decided to share with her nails lately.

"So, what's the plan today? I still got to figure out how that note got on the inside of my shop's door despite locking up before we left yesterday, and then I should probably sweep. If you girls want, you can help with tending to the plants." Audrey inquires once they're all finished eating.

"Actually, I was considering going over to the park you showed me yesterday. Perhaps I will be able to grant it the care it's been lacking for so long, as well as practice my growth ability some more." Flora answers.

"I'll tag along with Flora to this park she's talking about." Megan states, "I'm kind of curious about it."

"I'll help you out, Audrey. After all, what are sisters for?" Sara says. She quickly adds to Flora, "Please don't try to answer that, my green friend."

A few minutes later, the four ladies leave the house. Flora notes that Sara is not wearing the high heels she had on yesterday and this morning, but instead a pair of purple Converse tennis shoes. "Getting tired of those heels of yours, Sara?" Megan asks, almost jokingly.

"As if! I just wanted to wear something more practical for helping my sister out!" Sara replies with a laugh.

The group eventually arrives at Audrey's Little Shop of Wonders, splitting up from there. Flora continues on past, heading for the park, while Megan follows behind, needing to run to keep up with the plant girl's long, excited strides. A shrill noise blares from the store well behind them, causing Flora to stumble momentarily as she practically jumps out of her own skin in frightened surprise. The store alarm got her almost every time, and she greatly disliked it, but she understood why it was needed.

Understanding why humans steal, however, was another matter entirely, and one she was not particularly keen on trying to do so.

"Ah yes. It's just like I remember it... all run-down and wild. Feels like a Rattata could jump out at any moment!" Megan remarks as she steps foot in the abandoned park with Flora.

"A what?" Flora inquires.

"A Rattata. You know, from Pokemon?" Megan answers. "You've no idea what I'm even talking about, do you?"

"I don't. Sorry. Nor do I know what a "we you" is."

"I'll explain later. Anyway, where do you want to start while we wait for your proverbial battery to charge?"

Flora thinks it over, uncertain as to the answer of the goddess' question. She hasn't really thought of how to proceed here. However, she senses something from the plant life... as though it is telling her what it desires. The plant girl wonders why, and the answer presents itself: the plants want to help her, so great is their adoration of her. "I... I think I understand, now. Nature itself possesses a collective consciousness, and it is this which adores me... although it has yet to reveal why." she remarks, in awe of this revelation.

"Really? That's pretty cool! So, where would it like us to begin?" Megan replies.

"We start with the entangled benches, though I believe I may be able to handle this myself." Flora informs, approaching one of the benches. The plant girl closes her lilac eyes, concentrating upon asking the plants to withdraw from the man-made object. Sensing confusion over her request, and realizing a need for clarity, she tries again with simpler, easier to understand terms. The plants begin moving of their own accord, years of growth withdrawing from the bench. Megan stands there in shock and awe, while Flora opens her eyes and smiles in admiration of her success.

After a couple hours of testing her newfound ability, which included crafting a giant sculpture in her relative likeness at Megan's suggestion, Flora can sense a familiar sensation within her body. Her initial fear causes her to slowly sprout taller, her leaves rustling as they expand with her body, before she is able to focus on disallowing her growth to continue, pausing at roughly 10 feet tall. She looks down towards Megan, cheeks red with embarrassment over her little accident in front of one of her new friends.

"You don't need to feel embarrassed around me, Flora." Megan says, trying to reassure her. "I'm not judging you or anything. Everyone makes mistakes sometimes, and I'd be lying if I said I was an exception..."

"Oh?"

"Yeah. I experimented with Sara a bit, and wound up awakening her demigoddess self. Then there was that time I forgot to save my progress, and turned my game off..." Megan changes the subject. "How about for a challenge, you double your size and hold it there for a few hours?"

Flora considers the suggestion, and ultimately nods in compliance. The pleasant sensation returns, but as with yesterday, the voluptuous growing plant girl keeps it in line. She does note that it feels somewhat less intense this time... Perhaps regularly practicing may help keep the sensation in check in some way?

Regardless, she watches her perspective slowly rise, and feels the soles of her bare feet sink in to and push through the soil. She wiggles her expanding toes a little, absentmindedly, while her bones creak and groan like trees in a strong wind as they gain and support ever more mass. Her legs are already like twin tree trunks as she continues her ascent, yet as Megan notes upon curiously touching one, still as soft as ever. Her massive breasts... speak for themselves, even though they're no larger proportionately than they were at her normal height.

Finally, Flora halts her growth at 20 feet, her cherry blossom hair on top of her head just grazing the cusp of her sculpture counterpart's own impressive chest. With a content sigh, the giant plant girl takes a relaxing seat upon the ground. "I believe I'm improving in my control of this ability I possess." she remarks. She turns to look at Megan seated next to her, who is nearly as large as her. "However, I hope you aren't responsible for it. No offense, Megan, but I need to be able to control this on my own."

"None taken, Flora! I assure you, this is all your doing. No tricks on my part." Megan responds, smiling. "I mean, I've always tried to let the achievements of those I care about be their own, whether it be Davis beating me in a Pokemon battle, the early humans I watched over, or anything in between!"

Flora's smile widens upon hearing her goddess friend's response. While she relaxes, the plant girl's incredible mind begins to imagine the ways in which she can put her newly discovered ability to good use. She begins to believe that the flowers she's tended to growing especially well are because of this adoration and desire to aid her in any way she wishes. It seems plausible, and while it means she may not necessarily have to tend to them to get that effect, she by no means is going to stop doing the activity she greatly enjoys.
1531112111.title: An almost new trick

1533.content:
Monica - A girl genius that specializes in the science of genetics. Having graduated high school a few years early, she was able to get a PhD in the topic of cloning by the time she was 20 and was even able to get funding from the government to work in her own home. Publishing her success on cloning small animals using her experimental cloning machine it kept the science board preoccupied as she pursued her own personal agenda. Unknown to them, she was actually in the process of cloning herself. The clone however has a small mutation in her DNA that has a large impact on her body. Specifically, she will keep getting bigger and bigger.

Penny - The first of her kind, Penny is a small anthropomorphic rat girl that was produced by splicing human and rat DNA. Seeing as how a few interactive stories I've enjoyed have been lost, I'm making this interactive as their spiritual successor.

Here are the rules. Please follow them, or I'll edit or delete your addition.

- No male giants allowed.

- Giantesses must be gentle. That is to say friendly, kind, anti-evil. So crushing an evil person is acceptable.

- Please use proper grammar and spelling, and at least a paragraph in length.

- The focus is on growth, just as the title suggests. As such, please no instant or really fast growth.

- Weight gain and scat are not accepted. Sorry.

- Giantesses must reach a minimum height of 50 feet at least once in the story. I'd usually prefer that they don't shrink below their original height.

- Don't end the story.

That's basically it. Have fun, and feel free to email me if you have questions.

Just a caution that this interactive contains links to pictures that are decidedly NSFW in some paths. Discretion is advised.
